PERSEVERANCE.Definition: not giving up, even when things are hard

BETRAYAL.Definition: when someone breaks trust or is disloyal

INEVITABLY.Definition: in a way that it was sure to happen or couldn't be avoided

JAW.Definition: the lower part of the face

CROSSBITE.Definition: when the top and bottom teeth do not line up properly

JAWS.Definition: the upper and lower bones that hold the teeth

FLATTER.Definition: make them feel or look good

TEMPERAMENT.Definition: the way a person usually acts or feels

CONCRETE.Definition: clear and real, not just an idea

MONK.Definition: a man who lived in a religious community

PUREBRED.Definition: from parents of the same kind

INHERITANCE.Definition: the passing of features from parents to children

HEREDITY—TRAITS.Definition: the way traits or features are passed from parents to children

HEREDITY.Definition: the passing of features from parents to children

HEREDITARY.Definition: passed from parents to children by genes

MOLECULE.Definition: the smallest unit into which a substance can be divided

PNEUMONIA.Definition: a serious sickness of the lungs

HELICAL.Definition: shaped like a spiral (a curve that goes around a central tube)

SPIRAL.Definition: a shape made up of curves, each one above than the one before

DIFFRACTION.Definition: the way light bends when it hits something

SYMMETRY.Definition: the quality of having parts that match each other

HIT IT OFF.Definition: relate well to each other, get along

ASSUMED.Definition: thought it was true without proof, supposed to be the case

EQUAL FOOTING.Definition: having the same rights or position

RESENTED.Definition: felt angry or upset about it

THEORETICAL.Definition: based on ideas rather than experience or practice

HELIX.Definition: a shape that twists like a spring or spiral

PROCLAIMED.Definition: said it in a strong way

UNDERSTATEMENTS.Definition: something said in a way that made it seem smaller or less important

POSTULATED.Definition: suggested as an idea or explanation

ETHICAL.Definition: relating to moral principles or standards
